subject: Relief of FMC benefits to user fee agencies which were at default to the contractual obligation as on 19.02.2020 due to non-deposition of due  remittance
text: HRay <7ly <THTf qfetarut #M9 / Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (e WarF ak {othrf HA<T4) W47 / Fax : 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) vi-5 &a 6, Taer-10 , ERan, 7 fcrit-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 NHAI Policy Guidelines/PF Toll Plaza/2021 Policy Circular No.17.5.81, Dated April, 2021 (Decision taken on e-File No. 39680) Sub: Relief of FMC benefits to user fee agencies which were at default to the contractual obligation as on 19.02.2020 due to non-deposition of due remittance Ref: (i) MoRTH OM No. COVID-19/RoadMap/JS (H)/2020 dated 18.05.2020 (ii) NHAI Policy no.17.5.79 dated 28.05.2020 (iii) Ministry of Finance OM dated 19.02.2020 and 13.05.2020 With reference to the above OM'$ followed by office orders issued from time to time in this regard, Executive Committee (EC) in 465th meeting held on 26th March, 2021, (Agenda Item No. 465.02) decided to extend the Atamnirbhar Force Majeure benefits to agencies which were at default on 19.02.2020 but have subsequently deposited the remittance along with penal interest for the contracts executed to COVID-19 and continued during COVID-19 period only_ 2 The ROs/PIUs settle the Force Majeure Claims of COVID period after considering above relief approved by EC. This dispensation is not applicable to other Force Majeure claims and will cease after the closure of Force Majeure settlements of COVID-19 pandemic 3_ This issues with the approval of Competent Authority.
